content.raw:
Something to note is that STL maps are balanced binary trees so there is a bit of overhead when calling functions like `Lap` and `GetTime` especially when you have more items in the map. Measuring small code snippets at fine scale could potentially give out larger than expected values. 

`boost::unordered_map` can be a nice alternative which is a hash table and has constant complexity. This can be something to consider for 2.0 and not 1.5
content.html:
Something to note is that STL maps are balanced binary trees so there is a bit of overhead when calling functions like Lap and GetTime especially when you have more items in the map. Measuring small code snippets at fine scale could potentially give out larger than expected values.

boost::unordered_map can be a nice alternative which is a hash table and has constant complexity. This can be something to consider for 2.0 and not 1.5
